snippet: It has been frustrating to watch President Obama’s promises on immigration reform fade to protestations of impotence and the blaming of others.
abstract: Editorial urges Pres Obama to take stand in face of Republican opposition and make changes to immigration policy on his own; holds that current rate of deportations is both hurtful and unsustainable; asserts that Obama should extend Dream Act to immigrants who pose no criminal threat and suggests other reforms, such as abandonment of quota-based deportations.
lead_paragraph: It has been frustrating to watch President Obama’s promises on immigration reform fade to protestations of impotence and the blaming of others.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
